title: Gujarat to unveil to new tourism policy by next fortnightTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Gujarat to unveil to new tourism policy by next fortnight Published on : Wednesday, September 23, 2015
The Gujarat government is possible going to announce its new tourism policy within a fortnight. A presentation on the proposed policy was made to state Chief Minister Anandiben Patel Monday, according Gujarat Tourism Minister Saurabh Patel .
The government is likely to announce its new tourism policy within next seven to ten days, he said.
The proposed policy focuses on developing eco-tourism destinations besides promotion of wildlife tourism, the minister said.
The current tourism policy of the state was announced in 2009 and has been implemented since then.
“Through the new policy, the government will try to develop tourist destinations. We want to boost eco-tourism as well as wildlife tourism through it,” Patel added.
The proposed policy will also focus on infrastructure development for the hotel sector and try to attract more participation from the private sector, he added.
“The government is also planning to develop home stay facilities for tourists to give them a chance to experience daily life in Gujarat,” Patel said.
